About the school:


 The school has a lower student to teacher ratio than most schools in the district or state at 20 to 1.  Approximately 83% percent of the school children are on free or reduced lunch.  Fifty-seven percent of the children are hispanic, with three percent are asian/pacific islander, one percent native american, and one percent is african american. 

 

West Kearns Elementary School was built in1954 with later additions finished by 1963 to meet the growing population of the neighborhood. For many years the building housed two schools; an upper grade school and a lower grade school with student populations as high as 1400 students! As the residents in the area matured, the school has declined in population and it is now one school administered by one principal. However, it is still very large serving 700 students and more than 130 preschool students, including Head Start.   

For more information, visit our school’s web-site! 

 

Statistics taken from http://utah.schooltree.org/public/West-Kearns-Elementary-088706.html and http://www.graniteschools.org/SchoolSites/elementaryschools/elementarystoz/Pages/WestKearnsElementary.aspx
